name: objective_type
comment: objective type, see ObjectiveFunctionType in EMTG_enums.h
description:
objective function type
#0: minimum deltaV
#1: minimum time
#2: maximum final mass
#3: maximize initial mass
#4: depart as late as possible in the window
#5: depart as early as possible in the window
#6: maximize orbit energy
#7: minimize launch mass
#8: arrive as early as possible
#9: arrive as late as possible
#10: <PLACEHOLDER FOR FUTURE OBJECTIVE FUNCTIONS>
#11: maximum dry/wet ratio
#12: maximum arrival kinetic energy
#13: minimum BOL power
#14: maximize log_10(final mass)
#15: maximum log_e(final mass)
#16: maximum dry mass margin
#17: maximum dry mass
#18: maximum log_10(dry mass)
#19: maximum log_e(dry mass)
#20: minimize chemical fuel
#21: minimize chemical oxidizer
#22: minimize electric propellant
#23: minimize total propellant
#24: minimize waypoint tracking error
#25: minimize initial impulse magnitude
#26: maximize distance from central body

name: objective_journey
comment: Journey associated with objective function (if applicable)
description: Journey associated with objective function (if applicable)

name: include_initial_impulse_in_cost
comment: Include the initial impulse in calculating the delta-v objective function?
description: Include the initial impulse in calculating the delta-v objective function?

name: global_timebounded
comment: 0: unbounded, 1: bounded total time (note that the global arrival date bound is by definition the same as the last journey's arrival date bound and is not duplicated
description: 0: unbounded, 1: bounded total time (note that the global arrival date bound is by definition the same as the last journey's arrival date bound and is not duplicated

name: mission_type
comment: mission type, #0: MGALTS, #1: FBLTS, #2: MGALT, #3: FBLT, #4: PSBI, #5: PSFB, #6: MGAnDSMs, #7: CoastPhase, #8: SundmanCoastPhase, #9: variable phase type, #10: ProbeEntryPhase, #11 ControlLawThrustPhase
description:
phase type
#0: MGALTS
#1: FBLTS
#2: MGALT
#3: FBLT
#4: PSBI
#5: PSFB
#6: MGAnDSMs
#7: CoastPhase
#8: SundmanCoastPhase
#9: variable phase type
#10: ProbeEntryPhase
#11 ControlLawThrustPhase

name: NLP_solver_mode
comment: NLP solver mode,#0: find feasible point only,#1: find optimal solution,#2: satisfy equality constraints
description:
NLP solver mode
#0: find feasible point only
#1: find optimal solution
#2: satisfy equality constraints

name: MBH_always_write_archive
comment: Write every hop to the MBH archive, even if it is not an improvement?
description: Write every hop to the MBH archive, even if it is not an improvement?

name: MBH_archive_state_vector
comment: include state vector in MBH archive file?
description: include state vector in MBH archive file?

name: MBH_max_trials
comment: maximum number of trials for MBH
description: maximum number of trials for MBH

name: MBH_max_run_time
comment: maximum run time for MBH, in seconds
description: maximum run time for MBH, in seconds

name: MBH_max_step_size
comment: Maximum step size (uniform) or scale factor (other distributions)
description: Maximum step size (uniform) or scale factor (other distributions)

name: MBH_hop_distribution
comment: MBH hop probabilty distribution,#0: uniform,#1: Cauchy,#2: Pareto,#3: Gaussian
description:
MBH hop probabilty distribution
#0: uniform
#1: Cauchy
#2: Pareto
#3: Gaussian

name: MBH_write_every_improvement
comment: Write every MBH improvement for later animation?
description: Write every MBH improvement for later animation?

name: MBH_time_hop_probability
comment: probability of MBH time hop operation
description: probability of MBH time hop operation

name: skip_first_nlp_run
comment: Skip first NLP run in an MBH process?
description: Skip first NLP run in an MBH process?

name: NLP_objective_goal
comment: Objective value at which NLP stops
description: Objective value at which NLP stops

name: MBH_RNG_seed
comment: MBH RNG seed (negative number means system clock)
description: MBH RNG seed (negative number means system clock)

name: SPICE_leap_seconds_kernel
comment: SPICE leap seconds kernel - required for SPICE to work
description: SPICE leap seconds kernel - required for SPICE to work

name: ephemeris_source
comment: 0: static, 1: SPICE (default to static if no SPICE file supplied for a body), 2: SplineEphem
description: 0: static, 1: SPICE (default to static if no SPICE file supplied for a body), 2: SplineEphem

name: SplineEphem_points_per_period
comment: How many sample points should SplineEphem use per orbital period of each body?
description: How many sample points should SplineEphem use per orbital period of each body?

name: SplineEphem_non_central_body_sun_points_per_period
comment: How many sample points should SplineEphem use per orbital period of the sun with respect to the central body?
description: How many sample points should SplineEphem use per orbital period of the sun with respect to the central body?

name: SplineEphem_truncate_ephemeris_at_maximum_mission_epoch
comment: Truncate SplineEphem at maximum mission epoch?
description: Truncate SplineEphem at maximum mission epoch?\n#If you enable this option, global search will be impeded but you will save a lot of memory\n#Useful for monte-carlo, launch period analysis, etc.

name: earliestPossibleEpoch
comment: Beginning of the SplineEphem data set
description: Beginning of the SplineEphem data set

name: latestPossibleEpoch
comment: End of the SplineEphem data set
description: End of the SplineEphem data set

name: propagatorType
comment: Propagator type,#0: Keplerian propagator,#1: Integrated propagator
description: Propagator type\n#0: Keplerian propagator\n#1: Integrated propagator

name: integratorType
comment: Integrator type,#0: rk7813M adaptive step,#1: rk8 fixed step
description: Integrator type\n#0: rk7813M adaptive step\n#1: rk8 fixed step

name: integration_time_step_size
comment: integration step size (maximum for adaptive, fixed for fixed)
description: integration step size (maximum for adaptive, fixed for fixed)

name: allow_initial_mass_to_vary
comment: Allow the mass at the beginning of the first journey to vary up to the allowed maximum?
description: Allow the mass at the beginning of the first journey to vary up to the allowed maximum?

name: maximum_mass
comment: maximum possible mass of the spacecraft (kg)
description: maximum possible mass of the spacecraft (kg)

name: IspLT
comment: specific impulse of the engine used for low-thrust maneuvers
description: specific impulse of the engine used for low-thrust maneuvers

name: IspLT_minimum
comment: minimum specific impulse for variable specific impulse problems
description: minimum specific impulse for variable specific impulse problems

name: IspChem
comment: specific impulse of the engine used for impulsive maneuvers
description: specific impulse of the engine used for impulsive maneuvers

name: Thrust
comment: thrust of the spacecraft, in Newtons
description: thrust of the spacecraft, in Newtons

name: engine_type
comment: low-thrust engine type, from original EMTGv8 list
description:
low-thrust engine type
#0: fixed thrust/Isp
#1: constant Isp, efficiency, EMTG computes input power
#2: choice of power model, constant efficiency, EMTG chooses Isp
#3: choice of power model, constant efficiency and Isp
#4: continuously-varying specific impulse
#5: custom thrust and mass flow rate polynomial
#6: NSTAR
#7: XIPS-25
#8: BPT-4000 High-Isp
#9: BPT-4000 High-Thrust
#10: BPT-4000 Ex-High-Isp
#11: NEXT high-Isp v9
#12: VASIMR (argon, using analytical model)
#13: Hall Thruster (Xenon, using analytical model)
#14: NEXT high-ISP v10
#15: NEXT high-thrust v10
#16: BPT-4000 MALTO
#17: NEXIS Cardiff 8-15-201
#18: H6MS Cardiff 8-15-2013
#19: BHT20K Cardiff 8-16-2013
#20: Aerojet HiVHAC EM
#21: 13 kW STMD Hall high-Isp (not available in open-source)
#22: 13 kW STMD Hall high-thrust (not available in open-source)
#23: NEXT TT11 High-Thrust
#24: NEXT TT11 High-Isp
#25: NEXT TT11 Expanded Throttle Table
#26: 13 kW STMD Hall high-Isp 10-1-2014 (not available in open-source)
#27: 13 kW STMD Hall medium-thrust 10-1-2014 (not available in open-source)
#28: 13 kW STMD Hall high-thrust 10-1-2014 (not available in open-source)
#29: 2D Throttle table
#30: 1D Throttle table high-thrust
#31: 1D Throttle table high-Isp
#32: 2D polynomial fit

name: number_of_electric_propulsion_systems
comment: number of thruster systems (used to be called number of engines)
description: number of thruster systems (used to be called number of engines)

name: engine_duty_cycle
comment: percentage of time that engine can operate
description: percentage of time that engine can operate

name: thrust_scale_factor
comment: scale factor to apply to thrust ONLY, not mass flow rate, can use to approximate cosine loss
description: scale factor to apply to thrust ONLY, not mass flow rate, can use to approximate cosine loss

name: solar_power_model_type
comment: Solar power model type,#0: classic Sauer model,#1: polynomial (0th order on the left)
description: Solar power model type\n#0: classic Sauer model\n#1: polynomial (0th order on the left)

name: solar_power_gamma
comment: solar power coefficients gamma_1 through gamma_5, if all gamma = [1 0 0 0 0], then solar power is a simple 1/r^2
description: solar power coefficients gamma_1 through gamma_5, if all gamma = [1 0 0 0 0], then solar power is a simple 1/r^2

name: power_decay_rate
comment: power system decay rate (fraction per year)
description: power system decay rate (fraction per year)

name: power_system_decay_reference_epoch
comment: reference date when the power system begins to decay
description: reference date when the power system begins to decay

name: throttle_sharpness
comment: Throttle sharpness (higher means more precise, lower means smoother)
description: Throttle sharpness (higher means more precise, lower means smoother)

name: throttle_logic_mode
comment: Throttle logic mode #0: maximum number of thrusters,#1: minimum number of thrusters
description: Throttle logic mode\n#0: maximum number of thrusters\n#1: minimum number of thrusters

name: spacecraft_power_coefficients
comment: spacecraft power coefficients A, B, and C represent the power requirements of the spacecraft at a distance r from the sun, #i.e. heaters, communications, etc
description: spacecraft power coefficients A, B, and C\n#represent the power requirements of the spacecraft at a distance r from the sun\n#i.e. heaters, communications, etc

name: spacecraft_power_model_type
description: spacecraft power model type\n#0: P_sc = A + B/r + C/r^2\n#1: P_sc = A if P > A, A + B(C - P) otherwise

name: TCM_maneuver_fraction
comment: Post-DSM TCM magnitude as a fraction of DSM magnitude
description: Post-DSM TCM magnitude as a fraction of DSM magnitude

name: SpacecraftModelInput
comment: Spacecraft object input type,#0: Assemble from libraries,#1: Read .emtg_spacecraftoptions file,#2: Assemble from missionoptions object
description:
Spacecraft object input type
#0: Assemble from libraries
#1: Read .emtg_spacecraftoptions file
#2: Assemble from missionoptions object

name: solar_percentage
comment: Percentage of the Sun seen by the spacecraft
description: Percentage of the Sun seen by the spacecraft

name: solar_flux
comment: Solar constant (flux density at 1 AU) [W/m^2 = kg/s^3]
description: Solar constant (flux density at 1 AU) [W/m^2 = kg/s^3]

name: speed_of_light_vac
comment: Speed of light in a vacuum [m/s]
description: Speed of light in a vacuum [m/s]

name: ParallelShootingStateRepresentation
comment: state representation for parallel shooting (Cartesian, SphericalRADEC, SphericalAZFPA, COE, MEE)
description: state representation for parallel shooting (Cartesian, SphericalRADEC, SphericalAZFPA, COE, MEE)

name: PeriapseBoundaryStateRepresentation
comment: state representation for periapse boundary conditions (Cartesian, SphericalRADEC, SphericalAZFPA, COE, MEE, IncomingBplane, OutgoingBplane)
description: state representation for periapse boundary conditions (Cartesian, SphericalRADEC, SphericalAZFPA, COE, MEE, IncomingBplane, OutgoingBplane)

name: ParallelShootingConstraintStateRepresentation
comment: state representation for parallel shooting constraints (Cartesian or same as encoded states)
description: state representation for parallel shooting constraints (Cartesian or same as encoded states)

name: print_only_non_default_options
comment: Write only options that are *not* default into the .emtgopt file?
description: Write only options that are *not* default into the .emtgopt file?

name: output_file_frame
comment: reference frame for output file (0: J2000_ICRF, 1: J2000_BCI, 2: J2000_BCF, 3: TrueOfDate_BCI, 4: TrueOfDate_BCF, 5: Principle Axes, 6: Topocentric, 7: Polar)
description: reference frame for output file (0: J2000_ICRF, 1: J2000_BCI, 2: J2000_BCF, 3: TrueOfDate_BCI, 4: TrueOfDate_BCF, 5: Principle Axes, 6: Topocentric, 7: Polar)

name: output_dormant_journeys
comment: Output ephemeris for time spent waiting between journeys?
description: Output ephemeris for time spent waiting between journeys?

name: post_mission_wait_time
comment: How long to output an ephemeris after the mission end (days)
description: How long to output an ephemeris after the mission end (days)

name: forward_integrated_ephemeris_central_body_SPICE_ID
comment: SPICE ID of central body for forward integrated ephemeris
description: SPICE ID of central body for forward integrated ephemeris

name: add_control_switch_line_to_ephemeris
comment: Add control switch line to ephemeris?
description: Add control switch line to ephemeris?

name: append_control_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append control vector to ephemeris output?
description: Append control vector to ephemeris output?

name: append_thrust_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append thrust magnitude to ephemeris output?
description: Append thrust magnitude to ephemeris output?

name: append_mdot_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append mass flow rate to ephemeris output?
description: Append mass flow rate to ephemeris output?

name: append_active_power_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append active power to ephemeris output?
description: Append active power to ephemeris output?

name: append_number_of_active_engines_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append number of active propulsion systems to ephemeris output?
description: Append number of active propulsion systems to ephemeris output?

name: append_throttle_level_to_ephemeris_output
comment: Append throttle level to ephemeris output?
description: Append throttle level to ephemeris output?

name: call_system_to_generate_bsp
comment: Should EMTG make a system call to clean the .ephemeris file and call python to call spice to generate the bsp?

name: spice_utilities_path
comment: Where are the spice utilities brief and mkspk located?

name: spice_utility_extension
comment: What is the file extension on the spice utlities? Likely either ".exe" for Windows or "" for *nix

name: spacecraft_SPICE_ID
comment: SPICE ID of spacecraft for bsp

name: output_maneuver_and_target_spec_files
comment: Output maneuver and target spec files?
description: Output maneuver and target spec files?

name: generate_acceleration_model_instrumentation_file
comment: generates a complete output of all acceleration model data at each integration time step (only works for numerically integrated trajectories
description: generates a complete output of all acceleration model data at each integration time step (only works for numerically integrated trajectories

name: stop_after_journey
comment: Stop after a particular journey? (if this value is greater than the number of journeys, do the whole mission)
description: Stop after a particular journey? (if this value is greater than the number of journeys, do the whole mission)

name: run_inner_loop
comment: Which inner loop solver to run?
description:
which inner loop solver to run?
#0: none, evaluate trialX
#1: run MBH
#2: run constrained DE
#3: run NLP using trialX as initial guess
#4: filament walker

name: check_derivatives
comment: Check derivatives using NLP finite differencing?
description: Check derivatives using NLP finite differencing?
